skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
With precise applications of unmaking, any threat may be rendered null and void in turn.
Masters of the very laws of nature, Archmages hold dominion of the mind and the immaterial, bending it to their will.
Even the simplest plant is made up of millions upon millions of elements that allow it to function. Understanding and mastering the use of this knowledge is the height of intelligence.

effects.description: Duration +66% for Lifebloom and Shield of Saphery

skillTree.localised_description: Don’t let his love for greenery fool you into believing he is a passive individual. Whenever Anurion attends the White Tower in Saphery, he is often seen arguing with his peers, inevitably led by his short temper and cantankerousness to leave and swear never to return. It is due to the regularity of such outbursts that Anurion rarely visits the Tower.

Anurion’s wide collection of plants is out of this world. The Winter Palace’s walls are covered in lush vines and its grounds surrounded by terraced gardens, containing strange and exotic plants, some carnivorous, some sentient, and some both.

effects.description:
Medicinal Plants resource production: 20 bundles
	(local region)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mages of Saphery often work alongside the smiths of Vaul, tirelessly toiling away to improve the quality and edge of blades and arrows.

effects.description:
+6 Armour-piercing damage for spearmen units
	(all units in army)

-6 Base damage damage for spearmen units
	(all units in army)

+3 Armour-piercing missile damage for archer units
	(all units in army)

-3 Base missile damage for archer units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Raw life energy flows across the battlefield, mending broken bones and rejuvenating the weary.

effects.description:
Grants Army ability: "Storm of Renewal" to target Jade Wizard's army
	(own army)

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached

skillTree.localised_description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Awakening of the Wood"

skillTree.localised_description: Brilliant flames leap from casters outstretched hands, incinerating everything they touch.

effects.description: Miscast chance for "Flames of Hoeth Upgraded" -15%

skillTree.localised_description: Commanding the earth itself, the wizard cracks it open.
A thicket of briars will entangle the enemy, covering them in dry, flammable foliage.
The Archmage crackles and flows with energies that would unmake any mortal practitioner.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

skillTree.localised_description: By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached
Hit point replenishment cap not reached

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Regrowth Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: This spell causes gnarled, fibrous hands to emerge from beneath the ground, dragging the foe to a claustrophobic, suffocating end.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Dwellers Below"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Dwellers Below Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Kyrielle Greenkin, daughter of Anurion, spends most of her days at her father’s Winter Palace, taking care of his plants and aiding his experiments. Like her father, Kyrielle shares a deep love for plantlife, and she inherits Anurion’s magical prowess. She is a beautiful woman who could charm even the hardest of hearts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: Lileath is the patron of prophecies and beauty, strongly associated with innocence and forgiveness. Only the true of heart are granted her blessing, for she judges not the deeds but the heart’s desire.

ui_effects.localised_text: Intensity reduces from enemy winds spent

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: Such is this wizard’s mastery of magic that the Winds may be channeled, undaunted by surrounding chaos, to perform feats thought impossible amongst lesser races.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: The call of this enchanted warhorn mends wounds and fills quivers as nature itself answers.
With a single spell, massive vines burst out of the earth and destroy anything in their path, their sharp thorns and hardy stalks proving difficult for the enemy to cut through.
The plants and trees in the area reshape and grow wildly, blocking otherwise perfectly safe and usable paths from the enemy.

effects.description: Block Army action: Movement range is modified by an additional -10%

skillTree.localised_description: Years of experience in mounted combat has started to pay off; this one is always in command of both their force and its steeds.

effects.description:
Speed: +5% for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Hero's army)

Speed: +7% for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units
	(Hero's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Ellyrian Reavers units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The call of this enchanted warhorn mends wounds and fills quivers as nature itself answers.
Archmages of Saphery carry a great deal of respect. Their presence alone is enough to inspire the men as they channel the Winds to aid the coming battles.

skillTree.localised_description: Such magic-users may be wise and able to offer sage advice, especially if they have scried the region.

Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 4%
Boost Income action: Income is modified by an additional 6%

skillTree.localised_description: Oft-times, though you may have much, what you want the most is what your rivals have; such envy focuses the mind and creativity.

effects.description: Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 3
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 6
Steal Technology action: Research rate is increased by an additional 10

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: To sow discord and confuse the enemy, sending them down the wrong route or befuddling their senses.

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can block projectiles regardless of its facing.
